org.opends.server.replication.protocol

Class ReplServerStartMsg

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.replication.protocol.ReplicationMsg
      • org.opends.server.replication.protocol.StartMsg
        • org.opends.server.replication.protocol.ReplServerStartMsg

  • public class ReplServerStartMsg
extends StartMsg
    Message sent by a replication server to another replication server at Startup.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReplServerStartMsg

        public ReplServerStartMsg(int serverId,
                  java.lang.String serverURL,
                  java.lang.String baseDn,
                  int windowSize,
                  ServerState serverState,
                  long generationId,
                  boolean sslEncryption,
                  byte groupId,
                  int degradedStatusThreshold)
        Create a ReplServerStartMsg.
        Parameters:
        serverId - replication server id
        serverURL - replication server URL
        baseDn - base DN for which the ReplServerStartMsg is created.
        windowSize - The window size.
        serverState - our ServerState for this baseDn.
        generationId - The generationId for this server.
        sslEncryption - Whether to continue using SSL to encrypt messages after the start messages have been exchanged.
        groupId - The group id of the RS
        degradedStatusThreshold - The degraded status threshold

      • ReplServerStartMsg

        public ReplServerStartMsg(byte[] in)
                   throws java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Creates a new ReplServerStartMsg by decoding the provided byte array.
        Parameters:
        in - A byte array containing the encoded information for the ReplServerStartMsg
        Throws:
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - If the in does not contain a properly encoded ReplServerStartMsg.

    • Method Detail

      • decodeBody_V1

        public void decodeBody_V1(byte[] in,
                 int pos)
                   throws java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Decodes the body of a just received ReplServerStartMsg. The body is in the passed array, and starts at the provided location. This is for a PDU encoded in V1 protocol version.
        Parameters:
        in - A byte array containing the body for the ReplServerStartMsg
        pos - The position in the array where the decoding should start
        Throws:
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - If the in does not contain a properly encoded ReplServerStartMsg.

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes(short sessionProtocolVersion)
                throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Serializes the PDU using the provided replication protocol version. WARNING: should be overwritten by a PDU (sub class) we want to support older protocol version serialization for.
        Specified by:
        getBytes in class ReplicationMsg
        Parameters:
        sessionProtocolVersion - The protocol version to use for serialization. The version should normally be older than the current one.
        Returns:
        The encoded PDU.
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - When the encoding of the message failed because the UTF-8 encoding is not supported or the requested protocol version to use is not supported by this PDU.

      • getBytes_V1

        public byte[] getBytes_V1()
                   throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Get the byte array representation of this Message. This uses the version 1 of the replication protocol (used for compatibility purpose).
        Returns:
        The byte array representation of this Message.
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - When the encoding of the message failed because the UTF-8 encoding is not supported.
